business.headline: Think you're exempt from filing ITR? Your lifestyle may say otherwiseIt is no longer just about how much you earn. If your lifestyle tells a different story, the taxman is likely paying attention.

Who is Arun Srinivas, new India head of Meta?Arun Srinivas joined Meta (formerly Facebook) in September 2020. Arun Srinivas started his career in the fast-moving consumer goods (FMCG) space, joining Reebok in 1996.

We trapped ourselves: Data scientist's post on middle class spending sparks debateIs the middle class a victim of the system or just bad at managing money? A Mumbai-based data scientist sparks debate with a provocative take.

Sensex rises 600 points despite Israel-Iran tensions. What's fuelling the rally?On Monday morning, both benchmark indices opened firm despite geopolitical concerns, with the BSE Sensex rising 170.94 points to 81,289.54 and the NSE Nifty50 gaining 62.90 points to trade at 24,781.50 as of 10:19 am.

Foxconn ships 97% of India-made iPhones to US to dodge Trump's China tariffsThe numbers show that Apple has shifted its export focus from a mix of countries to mainly serving the U.S. market. Earlier, Indian exports were sent to places like the Netherlands, the Czech Republic, and the UK.

Tata Motors shares sink over 5% today. What's behind the sharp decline?The decline was primarily driven by a downward revision in Jaguar Land Rover's (JLR) earnings before interest and taxes (EBIT) margin forecast for the fiscal year 2026.

Gold price rises amid Israel-Iran tensions: Should you buy now or wait?Gold prices are rising again as global tensions heat up and markets turn cautious. With rates inching higher, should you be buying gold or waiting it out?
Sensex, Nifty open higher as IT stocks rally amid Israel-Iran conflictThe S&P BSE Sensex was up by 257.49 points to 81,376.09, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 83.20 points to 24,803.55 as of 9:29 am.

DLF set to invest Rs 5,500 crore to build luxury housing project in GurugramDLF has seen significant sales momentum in Gurugram, where its previous projects have sold out rapidly. Privana South, launched in January 2024, saw all 1,113 apartments sold in just three days, generating Rs 7,200 crore.

Stock market opening today: Will Sensex, Nifty crash again on June 16?Foreign institutional investors (FIIs) have maintained their selling stance for a third consecutive session, resulting in net outflows of Rs 54,020 crore in June alone. Domestic institutional investors (DIIs) have continued their buying spree.

Stocks to watch on June 16: Adani Enterprises, Sun Pharma, NTPC, Bajaj FinanceAs trading resumes on Monday, shares of several companies will be in focus due to fresh developments. These include Adani Enterprises, Sun Pharma, NTPC, Bajaj Finance, Vedanta, and others.

Advance tax alert: First instalment due by June 15, find out if you are liableAdvance tax simply means paying your income tax in parts throughout the year, instead of waiting till the end. If your total tax due for the year is more than Rs 10,000, then you must pay it in advance in four instalments.
Iran-Israel tensions rise. Why India should worryThe escalating Iran-Israel conflict poses significant challenges for India, particularly concerning oil imports and economic stability.

Sensex settles 573 points lower, Nifty below 24,800; Adani Ports falls 3%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 573.38 points to end at 81,118.60, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 169.60 points to close at 24,718.60.

Gold prices rise sharply amid Israel-Iran tensions in IndiaThe rise in gold prices is being linked to worries over a possible wider conflict in the Middle East, which has made investors turn to gold as a safe place to park money.

Oswal Pumps opens Rs 1,387 crore IPO with strong brokerage backingOswal Pumps targets Rs 1,387.34 crore from IPO. Experts recommend subscribing due to strong fundamentals. IPO open until June 17, 2025.

Air India crash rattles hotel and ticketing stocks, as investor confidence waversOnline travel companies were among the most affected. Shares of Thomas Cook India fell by 2.39%, trading at Rs 160.03 as of June 13, 1PM. TBO Tek dropped 1.10% to Rs 1,287.40, while Mahindra Holidays slipped 1.47% to Rs 342.35.

Air India crash: How airline insurance works and why premiums may riseIncidents like the recent Air India crash can result in a total loss, meaning the aircraft is beyond repair with no salvageable parts. In such cases, the losses can reach around $130 million, roughly $80 million for the plane and $30-50 million in liabilities.

Who are the likely insurers for Air India plane crash?The plane involved in the crash was a Boeing 787-8 Dreamliner, one of the most modern aircraft used in commercial aviation. It was carrying 242 people, including 12 crew members.

Boeing's revival on trial after deadly Air India Dreamliner crash in AhmedabadThe fatal crash of Air India flight AI-171, a Boeing 787-8 Dreamliner, minutes after takeoff from Ahmedabad, has killed 241 people on board, reigniting serious doubts over Boeing's aircraft safety and corporate oversight.

Oil shock hits Dalal Street: BPCL, ONGC, IOC, other crude-sensitive stocks fallBrent crude oil futures jumped more than 9% to touch around $75.61 per barrel, reaching a multi-month high. The gain came after Israel said it had launched what it called "preemptive strikes" against Iran.

RBI steps in to contain fallout of oil price jump on rupee: ReportThe Indian rupee dropped to 86.20 against the US dollar in early trade but later recovered to 86.04, helped by the central bank's likely intervention.

Aviation stocks tumble after Air India plane crash in AhmedabadSpiceJet's share price dropped 3.42% at the start of the trading session. InterGlobe Aviation Ltd, the company that runs IndiGo, also fell 4.83%, slipping to Rs 5,212 in early trade.
Sensex, Nifty crash as Israel attacks Iran; oil prices jump sharplyThe S&P BSE Sensex tanked 838.78 points to 80,853.20, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 252.80 points to 24,635.40 as of 9:25 am.

Sensex falls over 1,100 points. Why is the stock market falling today?The BSE Sensex was down 1121.35 points to 80,570.63 at 9:16 am, while the NSE Nifty50 tumbled 334.65 points to trade at 24,553.55.

Stock market opening: Will Sensex, Nifty crash today over Israel-Iran conflict?The situation in the Middle East has affected global investor sentiment. Oil prices also jumped on fears that the strikes could affect supply from the region, which is known for producing large amounts of oil.

Stocks to watch on June 13: Tata Group, RIL, HCL, Asian Paints, ICRA, ICICI BankShares of several Tata Group companies, such as Tata Motors, Tata Steel and Tata Chemicals, are expected to remain in the spotlight after the crash of Air India flight AI171 in Ahmedabad shortly after takeoff.

Boeing shares slide 5% after Air India Dreamliner crash kills over 200Flight AI171, bound for London, went down minutes after departure, killing more than 200 people in what is now the world's deadliest aviation disaster in a decade. The cause of the crash remains unclear.

Tata Group to give Rs 1 crore to families of Ahmedabad Air India crash victimsTata Group will offer Rs 1 crore to family members of people who lost their lives in the Ahmedabad crash of Air India Flight 171, which killed over 200 people on Thursday.

This is a difficult day for us: Air India CEO reacts to Ahmedabad plane crashAt least 204 people were killed and 41 injured after the London-bound Air India flight crashed just minutes after taking off from Ahmedabad's Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel International Airport on Thursday.

Retail inflation hits six-year low, falls to 2.82% in May 2025The decline in retail inflation is mainly because food prices rose at a much slower pace than before. Cheaper vegetables, fruits, cereals, and pulses helped bring food inflation down sharply. In May, food inflation fell to 0.99% from 1.78% in April.

Sensex tanks 823 points, Nifty falls below 25,000; Tata Motors falls 3%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 823.16 points to close at 81,691.98, while the NSE Nifty50 fell by 253.20 points to settle at 24,888.20.

Boeing reacts to Air India plane crash in Ahmedabad, says aware of initial reportsThe London-bound flight AI-171, carrying 242 people including 230 passengers and 12 crew members, crashed in the Meghaninagar area near the Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel International Airport minutes after takeoff. The plane had issued a mayday call before losing contact with air traffic control.

Shocked and deeply saddened: Gautam Adani after Air India plane crash in AhmedabadOn Thursday afternoon, an Air India flight heading to London crashed just minutes after take-off, with 242 people on board. The flight, AI-171, was being operated by a Boeing 787 Dreamliner.

Focus on supporting affected people: Tata Group chief on Ahmedabad plane crashThe airplane crash has led to a temporary suspension of flight operations at Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel International Airport.

Boeing shares tumble 8% after Air India flight crashes in AhmedabadBoeing shares nosedived over 8% in pre-market trade after the Air India Dreamliner crash in Ahmedabad, deepening investor concerns over the jetmaker's safety record and regulatory troubles.

Google offers buyout plans amid AI-focused overhaul: ReportGoogle is now giving some employees the option to leave the company with a severance package. This is being called a "voluntary exit programme", as per reports.

Dalal Street dips nearly 1 percent on global trade and geopolitical concernsStock market today: The fall occurred despite markets erasing early losses as the S&P BSE Sensex fell by 911 points to 81,603.95 and the NSE Nifty50 lost 288.75 points to 24,854.45 by 2:29 pm.

India to tighten remittance rules, bar offshore time deposits: ReportThe Reserve Bank of India (RBI) will amend regulations to prevent overseas transfers from being used to park money in time deposits or other interest-bearing accounts abroad, one of the sources said.

PM-Kisan 20th instalment: When will farmers get the next Rs 2,000?This scheme provides income support of Rs 6,000 a year to eligible farmers. The money is paid in three equal parts of Rs 2,000, directly into the farmers' bank accounts.

entertainment.headline: Did Kriti Sanon just confirm joining Don 3? Her viral reaction hints soIt looked like actor Kriti Sanon seemingly confirmed her entry into 'Don 3' following Kiara Advani's exit from the project. A video of Sanon blushing as paps called her 'Lady Don' is going viral.
Justin Bieber publicly ends friendship after being called out for angerJustin Bieber's friend voiced frustration after the singer lashed out at him.

Prabhas's 40-foot cutout unveiled ahead of The Raja Saab teaserA massive 40-foot cutout of Telugu superstar Prabhas was unveiled outside Hyderabad's Prasads Theatre on Monday. Fans celebrated the teaser launch of his upcoming film, 'The Raja Saab', with dhols, dance, and other rituals.

Keerthy Suresh's Uppu Kappurambu gears up for OTT premiere in JulyActor Keerthy Suresh's upcoming Telugu film 'Uppu Kappurambu' is set to premiere on Prime Video on July 4. The film talks about a societal issue in a humourous manner.

The Raja Saab teaser: Chills and thrills galore in Prabhas's horror comedyThe teaser of director Maruthi and Prabhas's 'The Raja Saab' was unveiled on June 16 amid massive anticipation. The film is gearing up for a grand release on December 5.

Why Will Smith said no to Inception, one of Christopher Nolan's biggest filmsActor Will Smith revealed that he turned down a role in Christopher Nolan's 'Inception', admitting he didn't fully grasp the concept at the time. "I just didn't understand it," the Oscar winner said in a recent interview.

Ben Affleck reveals why he made an exception for The Accountant 2; ReadBen Affleck makes a rare return to his role in The Accountant 2, influenced by strong fan support and a compelling script. The sequel explores complex characters and moral dilemmas.

Singer Cher's son Elijah Blue Allman hospitalised after drug overdose: ReportAmerican actor-singer Cher's son, Elijah Blue Allman, was hospitalised on June 14 over an alleged drug overdose. Authorities said Elijah was acting erratically when deputies from Morongo Basin Station reached his residence.

Aamir Khan breaks silence on backlash over late response to Pahalgam terror attackActor Aamir Khan has responded to criticism over his delayed reaction to the Pahalgam terror attack, clarifying that it had nothing to do with promoting his upcoming film, 'Sitaare Zameen Par'. He explained that the delay was because he is not active on social media.

Singer Jonita recalls being tagged in obscene Instagram post, calls it harassmentSinger Jonita Gandhi revealed she was tagged in an explicit Instagram story featuring her photo in the background, calling it harassment. She said while she reports and blocks such users, she worries about her mother seeing such content on her profile.

Fatima Sana Shaikh clarifies remarks on casting couch: Not entire South industryActor Fatima Sana Shaikh clarified that her casting couch remark was about a specific incident and not a reflection of the entire South film industry. She said her words were taken out of context and unnecessarily blown out of proportion.

Priyanka Chopra shares Malti's cute nickname for Nick Jonas in Father's Day postPriyanka Chopra and Nick Jonas celebrated Father's Day with their daughter Malti Marie. Sharing a series of photos, the actor revealed Malti's adorable nickname to her father.

Kuberaa trailer: Dhanush, Nagarjuna's gripping film is battle between money, powerDirector Sekhar Kammula's 'Kuberaa' is a thrilling battle between money and power. While Dhanush plays a beggar who shakes the government, Nagarjuna will be seen as a powerful man with multiple shades.

Atlee on plagiarism amid AA22xA6-Dune poster row: Earned this only through honestyDirector Atlee recently addressed the allegations about his films being copied from other works. The filmmaker also shared his vision for Allu Arjun and Deepika Padukone's 'AA22xA6'.

Rishab Shetty and crew unhurt after boat capsizes during Kantara Chapter 1 shootA boat capsized during the shooting of actor-director Rishab Shetty's 'Kantara: Chapter 1' at Shivamogga's Mani reservoir. Shetty and the crew members escaped unharmed from the incident.

Actor Kushal Tandon confirms breakup with Shivangi Joshi in now-deleted postActor Kushal Tandon confirmed his breakup with 'Barsaatein' co-star Shivangi Joshi in a now-deleted post. Tandon shared that the two had parted ways five months back.

Anushka Sharma's Father's Day post is a letter from Vamika to Virat KohliActor Anushka Sharma shared a special handwritten note by her daughter, Vamika, for Virat Kohli. The special letter has left fans in awe.

Actor Unni Mukundan's Marco 2 dropped, actor says too much negativity'Marco' actor Unni Mukundan has dropped all plans to continue the film series. Citing 'negativity' around the project, the actor mentioned that he will not be a part of the sequel.

Sardaar Ji 3 teaser: Diljit Dosanjh returns as ghost hunter in hilarious avatarThe teaser of 'Sardaar Ji 3' starring Diljit Dosanjh and Neeru Bajwa is out. The film will release in theatres on June 27.

general news.headline: Pak assured tit-for-tat if Israel used N-bomb on us, Iran says; Islamabad denies"Pakistan has told us that if Israel uses a nuclear bomb on Iran, then Pakistan will also attack Israel with a nuclear bomb," General Mohsen Rezaei, an IRGC commander and member of Iran's National Security Council, said on Iranian state television.

Air India Dreamliner returns to Hong Kong after suspected mid-air snag: SourcesJust days after a fatal Dreamliner crash in Ahmedabad, another Air India Boeing 787-8 flight was forced to turn back to Hong Kong mid-air due to a suspected technical glitch.

Live: US embassy in Tel Aviv suffers damage after Iranian strike, shut for todayIsrael Iran Conflict Live Updates: Israel continued its military strikes on Iran for a third straight day, targeting Tehran and other regions, killing 224 people, including Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps (IRGC) intelligence chief Mohammed Kazemi and two generals. Israel's airspace and airports were shut down. Army chief Eyal Zamir vowed to intensify the attacks against what he called an "existential threat".

Filmmaker missing after Air India crash, wife's agonising search continuesAccording to Mahesh Kalawadia's wife, the police informed her that his phone was located 700 meters from the crash site and went off a minute before the flight took off.
Israel-Iran war: The bleak choice before Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali KhameneiIran now stands exposed and vulnerable with Israeli jets flying with impunity from the Mediterranean to the Arabian Sea.

Aamir Khan breaks silence on backlash over late response to Pahalgam terror attackActor Aamir Khan has responded to criticism over his delayed reaction to the Pahalgam terror attack, clarifying that it had nothing to do with promoting his upcoming film, 'Sitaare Zameen Par'. He explained that the delay was because he is not active on social media.

Iran allows evacuation of Indian nationals via land borders; over 10,000 strandedResponding to India's request, Iran has mentioned that since it has shut its airspace down, students can use its land borders to cross into Azarbaijaan, Turkmenistan and Afghanistan. India is currently mulling an evacuation operation from Iran for its nationals.
Think you're exempt from filing ITR? Your lifestyle may say otherwiseIt is no longer just about how much you earn. If your lifestyle tells a different story, the taxman is likely paying attention.

Longevity unlocked: Can we really reverse our biological age?The global anti-ageing market is rapidly expanding with a growing demand for personalised and scientific approaches. India is gradually shifting focus from visible ageing signs to deeper biological health for longevity.

From today, your UPI transactions will be faster: What it means for PhonePe, Google Pay and Paytm usersStarting today, UPI users across India can expect their transactions to complete faster than before. The NPCI has introduced new guidelines that reduce the time it takes for a UPI transaction to be processed.

Please stop: Plane crash victim's cousin slams influencers for exploiting tragedyKuldeep Bhatt, the cousin of Komi Vyas, who perished in the Air India crash along with her husband and their three children, spoke out against the "mental trauma" being inflicted upon his family and the families of the 270 other victims by irresponsible online content.

We trapped ourselves: Data scientist's post on middle class spending sparks debateIs the middle class a victim of the system or just bad at managing money? A Mumbai-based data scientist sparks debate with a provocative take.
No rings, no roles, no rules: The freedom of Relationship AnarchyInstead of assuming roles, Relationship Anarchy invites you to co-create relationships that fit the needs of the partners.

Iran wants to kill Trump, plotted assassination: Netanyahu's explosive claimIsraeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu claimed that Iran's Islamic regime had plotted to assassinate US President Donald Trump, labelling him as enemy number one.

Cockpit Voice Recorder found from Air India plane crash siteOfficials confirmed the recovery of the Cockpit Voice Recorder found from the Air India plane crash site. The probe intensifies from the Air India crash site in Ahmedabad, aiding the ongoing probe into the tragedy that killed 270 people.

AUS remain at the top of ICC Test rankings despite WTC loss to SADespite losing the World Test Championship final to South Africa, Australia maintained their lead in the latest update of the ICC Test team rankings with the Proteas jumping up to second in the charts.

Tourists panic as snake slithers into Mussoorie's Kempty Falls. Terrifying videoIn the video, visitors are seen enjoying themselves in the scenic pool at the base of Kempty Falls - a well-known tourist attraction that also features both shallow and deep zones for safe swimming.

Hajj flight faces wheel glitch at Lucknow airport; smoke, sparks seenA Saudia Airlines flight carrying Hajj pilgrims landed safely in Lucknow despite smoke and sparks from a wheel caused by a hydraulic leak. All 250 onboard were safely evacuated.

Don't watch such nonsense, Sonam told woman viewing Raja Raghuvanshi case reelsIn an interview with India Today TV, Ujala Yadav shared details of her brief encounter with Sonam Raghuvanshi on the night of June 8, just hours before her arrest in the Raja Raghuvanshi murder case.

Why Virat Kohli did not speak to AB de Villiers for months? Legend revealsAB de Villiers revealed Virat Kohli stopped speaking to him after he leaked the news about Anushka being pregnant with the latter's second child.

Amid Israel-Iran conflict, India balances ties with both nations carefullyIndia balances strategic ties with both Israel and Iran amid rising tensions, focusing on diplomacy, defence interests, and regional stability while avoiding alignment with either side.

Just like I got India and Pak...: Trump says Israel, Iran will make dealRepeating his claim that he brokered the India-Pakistan ceasefire following their conflict, US President Donald Trump claimed there would be peace between Israel and Iran "soon" amid escalating hostilities between both Middle East nations.

Trump vetoed Israel's plan to assassinate Iran's Supreme Leader: ReportAccording to the top officials, Israel informed the US of an opportunity to assassinate Iran's Supreme Leader but Trump vetoed the plan.

Centre announces dates for population census, to be held in two phasesThe Union Home Ministry on Monday announced that the population census -- India's first since 2011 -- will be conducted in two phases, on October 1, 2026, and March 1, 2027, respectively.

sports.headline: Washington Sundar has been my inspiration since I was young: Sai SudharsanSai Sudharsan, recently named in India's red-ball squad for the five-match Test series against England, has shared that fellow Chennai cricketer Washington Sundar has been an inspiration to him since he was a child.

Siraj must aim to become frontline bowler for India: Former bowling coachFormer India bowling coach Bharat Arun has advised Mohammed Siraj to become India's frontline bowler in the upcoming Test series against England.

An Indian cricketer told me to retire: Karun Nair reveals ahead of Test comebackKarun Nair has revealed that about two years ago, a 'prominent Indian cricketer' advised him to consider retiring and focus on securing his future through overseas T20 leagues-something only possible if he severed ties with the BCCI, as per board rules.

ENG vs IND: Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy launch delayed due to Ahmedabad air tragedyThe launch of the Anderson-Tendulkar trophy has been delayed due to the Ahmedabad plane crash tragedy. England and India will now play for the Anderso Tendulkar trophy in England instead of Pataudi Trophy.

India vs Pakistan women's ODI World Cup set for October 5 in Colombo: ReportThe women's ODI World Cup will reportedly kick off on 30 September, with India taking on Sri Lanka at the M. Chinnaswamy Stadium in Bengaluru.

Jaiswal on cusp of history, eyes Dravid and Sehwag's major record in EnglandStar India batter Yashasvi Jaiswal is on the cusp of history as he has a golden chance to become the fastest Indian player to complete 2000 runs in Test cricket.

England to beat India 3-2: Dale Steyn makes bold prediction ahead of Test seriesFormer South African fast-bowling great Dale Steyn has predicted that each match in the upcoming five-Test series will be closely contested, yet produce a definitive result. Steyn believes England will beat India to clinch the series 3-2.

Who's taken Rohit Sharma's seat on the team bus? Kuldeep Yadav revealsStar India spinner Kuldeep Yadav has revealed who's taken Rohit Sharma's place on the Indian team bus. Rohit Sharma recently announced his retirement from Tests ahead of the series against England.

India's intra-squad match called off after Shardul hits 122 vs Bumrah, SirajShardul Thakur made a case for his inclusion in India's playing XI for the first Test against England after starring with both bat and ball in India A's intra-squad match. His performance intensifies the race for the all-rounder spot ahead of the England Test series.

Mitchell Johnson questions Josh Hazlewood for prioritising IPL after WTC final lossFormer Australia fast bowler Mitchell Johnson has questioned Josh Hazlewood for prioritising the Indian Premier League (IPL) ahead of national commitments after loss in the WTC final.

PSG thrash Atletico Madrid, Bayern Munich demolish Auckland CityParis Saint-Germain crushed Atletico Madrid 4-0 in their march toward global domination at the FIFA Club World Cup on Sunday, while Bayern Munich showed no mercy to Auckland's amateurs, delivering a ruthless 10-0 thrashing.

England to beat India 3-2: Dale Steyn makes bold prediction ahead of Test seriesFormer South African fast-bowling great Dale Steyn has predicted that each match in the upcoming five-Test series will be closely contested, yet produce a definitive result. Steyn believes England will beat India to clinch the series 3-2.

Who's taken Rohit Sharma's seat on the team bus? Kuldeep Yadav revealsStar India spinner Kuldeep Yadav has revealed who's taken Rohit Sharma's place on the Indian team bus. Rohit Sharma recently announced his retirement from Tests ahead of the series against England.

India's intra-squad match called off after Shardul hits 122 vs Bumrah, SirajShardul Thakur made a case for his inclusion in India's playing XI for the first Test against England after starring with both bat and ball in India A's intra-squad match. His performance intensifies the race for the all-rounder spot ahead of the England Test series.

Mitchell Johnson questions Josh Hazlewood for prioritising IPL after WTC final lossFormer Australia fast bowler Mitchell Johnson has questioned Josh Hazlewood for prioritising the Indian Premier League (IPL) ahead of national commitments after loss in the WTC final.

PSG thrash Atletico Madrid, Bayern Munich demolish Auckland CityParis Saint-Germain crushed Atletico Madrid 4-0 in their march toward global domination at the FIFA Club World Cup on Sunday, while Bayern Munich showed no mercy to Auckland's amateurs, delivering a ruthless 10-0 thrashing.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
